item.title: Alice add a quote by Marilyn Hacker
item.description: "imagine that it were given back to me to be the child who knew departure would be sweet, the boy who drew square-rigged ships, the girl who knew truck routes from ottawa to mexico, the me who found a door in latin verse and made a map out of hexameters." -- Marilyn Hacker

item.title: Alice add a quote by Marilyn Hacker
item.description: "Did you love well what you very soon left? Come home and take me in your arms and take away this stomach ache, headache, heartache." -- Marilyn Hacker

item.title: Alice add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "You’ll get over it…” It’s the clichés that cause the trouble. To lose someone you love is to alter your life for ever. You don’t get over it because ‘it” is the person you loved. The pain stops, there are new people, but the gap never closes. How could it? The particularness of someone who mattered enough to grieve over is not made anodyne by death. This hole in my heart is in the shape of you and no-one else can fit it. Why would I want them to?" -- Jeanette Winterson
